Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or proof to support the existence of real skeletons of mythical creatures at the Merrylin Cryptid Museum.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the photographs and relics found at the Merrylin Cryptid Museum are genuine and not fabricated or hoaxed.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no record of an ageless cryptologist named "Professor Thomas Theodore Merrylin" associated with the museum.
Understate: The claim may be understating the skepticism and doubts surrounding the authenticity of the skeletons and the credibility of the museum.
Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the potential impact of the macabre findings on changing science as we know it.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the skeletons and artifacts displayed at the Merrylin Cryptid Museum could be artistic creations or sculptures rather than real remains.
